alert.note: Alert for Henderson (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued March 06 at 9:37PM EST until March 06 at 11:30PM EST by NWS Paducah
info.description: The National Weather Service in Paducah has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Vanderburgh County in southwestern Indiana... North Central Henderson County in northwestern Kentucky... * Until 1030 PM CST. * At 837 PM CST, Doppler radar indicated an area of thunderstorms producing very heavy rain moving into the Evansville and Henderson metro areas. These storms will produce 1 to 2 inches of rain in 1 hour. This will cause flash flooding to develop, especially in poorly-drained urban areas. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Evansville, Henderson, Newburgh, Melody Hill, Darmstadt and Kasson. This includes the following highways... Audubon Parkway near Mile Marker 1. Interstate 69 in Indiana between Mile Markers 1 and 5...and between Mile Markers 8 and 12. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...1-2 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
